meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of Malawi.
meanings.sent1: In Malawi, people use kwachas to buy things.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for kwachas at the bank.
meanings.sent3: The kwachas in my wallet were dancing around happily.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a million kwachas.
meanings.sent5: The colorful kwachas sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: She had many kwachas in her purse.
meanings.sent2: The market was bustling with vendors accepting kwachas.
meanings.sent3: The kwachas rolled off the table and onto the floor.
meanings.sent4: His words were like kwachas, valuable and impactful.
meanings.sent5: The sound of kwachas jingling was music to his ears.
